p: In insulin resistance, the gene PGC-1α, a regulator of enzymes involved in mitochondrial respiration, shows reduced expression [ 36, 39]. Additionally, PGC-1α is repressed by PARIS (ZNF746), a protein that causes neurodegeneration in PD due to parkin inactivation [ 37]. Many researchers observed that PGC-1α protects against the destruction of dopaminergic neurons [ 37, 38]. As a consequence, the decreased protection of these neurons in T2DM may lead to the development of PD.
